=Using the !FileBrowser with TinyMCE=

You can also replace the TinyMCE Image/File Manager with the !FileBrowser.
What you have to do is a !FileBrowser Callback. ThereÂ´s an example in /media/js/ called tinymceAdmin.js - you can copy the !FileBrowserCallback to your own file or take a look at http://www.rorlach.de/mediawiki/index.php/Custom_filebrowser.

To use the !FileBrowser with TinyMCE, just add these lines to your model:
{{{
js = (
    'filebrowser/js/AddFileBrowser.js',
    'tinymce/jscripts/tiny_mce/tiny_mce.js',
    'js/custom/tinymce_admin.js',
)
}}}
